nodes.body: Can you replace the `R : Type` by `R : Type*`? (Lines 48, 51, 67.) This would make the target ring universe-polymorphic (and doesn't seem to break anything).

> Can you replace the `R : Type` by `R : Type*`? (Lines 48, 51, 67.) This would make the target ring universe-polymorphic (and doesn't seem to break anything).

Yeah, good idea, done.

Looks good to me now.

Looks good to me, thanks!

bors d+
Looks good to me now.
Seems fine to me!

Looks good to me, thanks!

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion χ.conductor ≤ (Classical.choose hd.2 ).conductor := by ```
The name of this lemma does not match the statement, Maybe `conductor_le_conductor_mem_conductorSet`?
yes, done
I think "reduction" is too generic. Why not `primitiveCharacter` instead?
`primitiveCharacter` is quite long, I am happy with `PrimitiveChar` or simply `Primitive`
I think `primitiveCharacter` would be better, than to abbreviate it, and changed it as such, but have no strong feelings...

```suggestion
  refine Nat.sInf_le <| (mem_conductorSet_iff χ).mpr <|
    ⟨dvd_trans (conductor_dvd_level _) hd.1,
     (factorsThrough_conductor (Classical.choose hd.2)).2.choose, ?_⟩
```

```suggestion
  exact FactorsThrough.eq_changeLevel χ hd
```

```suggestion
  by_cases h : χ.conductor = 0
  · rw [isPrimitive_def]
    convert conductor_eq_zero_iff_level_eq_zero.mpr h
  · exact le_antisymm (Nat.le_of_dvd (Nat.pos_of_ne_zero h) (conductor_dvd_level _)) <|
      conductor_le_conductor_mem_conductorSet _ <| conductor_mem_conductorSet χ
```
(don't rely on the name `h` used by `by_cases` by default)
I'm happy to change that, but why not rely on the default name?

(The `_` before the last `<|` should go; in my test file I mistakenly had an explicit argument there.)
Relying on the deault name has the problem that a reader of the proof has to know about it (and the possible problem that the proof could break at some point if the default is changed).
In fact, I think that `by_cases` should use an inaccessible name by default, similarly to most other tactics.

What you write about `by_cases` seems reasonable, I started a discussing about it here:

https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60by_cases.60using.20the.20default.20argument

```suggestion
      conductor_le_conductor_mem_conductorSet <| conductor_mem_conductorSet χ
```

```suggestion
    χ.conductor ≤ (Classical.choose hd.2).conductor := by
```

Since `reduction` got renamed to `primitiveCharacter`, it would be good for searchability to also rename the lemmas about it.
```suggestion
lemma primitiveCharacter_isPrimitive : isPrimitive (χ.primitiveCharacter) := by
  by_cases h : χ.conductor = 0
  · rw [isPrimitive_def]
    convert conductor_eq_zero_iff_level_eq_zero.mpr h
  · exact le_antisymm (Nat.le_of_dvd (Nat.pos_of_ne_zero h) (conductor_dvd_level _)) <|
      conductor_le_conductor_mem_conductorSet <| conductor_mem_conductorSet χ

lemma primitiveCharacter_one (hn : n ≠ 0) :
    (1 : DirichletCharacter R n).primitiveCharacter = 1 := by
  rw [eq_one_iff_conductor_eq_one <| (@conductor_one R _ _ hn) ▸ Nat.one_ne_zero,
      (isPrimitive_def _).1 (1 : DirichletCharacter R n).primitiveCharacter_isPrimitive,
      conductor_one hn]
```
of course!
